page.title: 05Morwenstow old houses
page.content: These vary from manors to farms and cottages. Many are fine examples of their type. Some are listed buildings possibly eligible for grant aid from the local authority, with restrictions on alterations. Except for those con- cerned with religion, trade or educat- ion the properties are family homes not open to the public. {Tonacombe}and {Marsland Manors }are both of medieval origin. {Tonacombe}has a particularly fine and unaltered Tudor interior. The {Bush Inn}at{Crosstown}and{Rectory Farm both claim 13th century origin, and are open to the public as a public house and tea room respectively.{"Sun- {shine Alley"}at{Crosstown }is a good example of a traditional cob and thatch cottage. At{Shop, Chapel House may be built on the site of a medieval chapel. (see School and Hawker)
